campgrounds.name: Beaver Point Resort
campgrounds.address: 16278 Hwy 35 Burns Lake, BC V0J 1E0
campgrounds.description: Nestled on the shores of Tchesinkut Lake, Beaver Point Resort rests on a large, beautiful property surrounded by lush forests. We are a family-oriented campground, ideal for families to spend quality time and create unforgettable memories. We have different types of accommodations to suit all needs, including cabins, cottages, and campsites. All are located along the lakeshore and have fantastic views of the lake and wilderness. Our family campground has grassed sites with electricity and water, as well sites with full-service hook-ups and gravel pads. Stay in our rustic cabins which features electric lights, fridge and heaters. A propane cookstove is provided to create delicious meals. The cozy cottages are equipped with a kitchen and comfortable beds. Choose from our one or two bedroom cottages, whichever suits your needs. We have various amenities throughout the resort to create a comfortable experience. Bring your boat as we have a fantastic boat launch and boat trailer storage. We have boats, motors and kayaks available for rent. Spend your summer days by the lake with the whole family.

campgrounds.name: Capilano River RV Park
campgrounds.address: 295 Tomahawk Ave., North Vancouver, BC V7P 1C5
campgrounds.description: RV parking & camping in Vancouver, also tenting. The most direct in Vancouver on Hwy 1. Exit Capilano Road S. Or Hwy 99 Exit N. Van. Off Lions Gate Bridge. OAP rates, special winter rates.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesServiced $54-$84 Partial Service $49-$66 Unserviced $44-$54 Tenting $44-$54

campgrounds.name: Gallagher Lake | A Parkbridge Camping & RV Resort
campgrounds.address: 8439 Hwy 97 Oliver, BC V0H 1T2
campgrounds.description: Located on the stunning Gallagher Lake in the South Okanagan Valley, Gallagher Lake RV Resort is surrounded by magnificent Ponderosa pines. The perfect destination for family camping, our resort is equipped with modern facilities to make a comfortable stay. With unmatched and consistent good weather, days will be spent at our private sandy beach soaking in the sun. Choose your choice of accommodation at Gallagher Lake RV Resort, whether it’s a RV site, rustic tent sites or cabin rentals, we have your priorities covered. Take advantage of the array of amenities we provide, including a tennis court, internet, coffee bar and grocery store on site, and washroom facilities. Hop on your bike or enjoy a scenic walk along the beautiful trails that are located only a short distance away from our resort. Our family oriented resort is located 10 minutes from Oliver, and a close drive to Penticton and Osoyoos to visit award winning wineries and vineyards.

campgrounds.name: Golden Golf Club RV Park
campgrounds.address: 576 Golf Course Drive Golden, BC V0A 1H0
campgrounds.description: Located in the Rocky Mountains, the Golden Golf Club R.V. Park is just minutes west of Golden, B.C. Adjacent the RV Park is our 18 hole golf course, practice facilities, restaurant, mini-golf course and in close proximity to Kicking Horse Mountain Resort, hiking, cycling trails and Golden Town Centre. CP 48 hours. Free WiFi.

campgrounds.name: Rondalyn | A Parkbridge Camping & RV Resort
campgrounds.address: 1350 Timberlands Road Ladysmith, BC V9G 1L5
campgrounds.description: A beautiful forested Parkbridge Resort with a big rig friendly park on Halsam Creek is the ideal destination for families to have a fun filled vacation. Offering year round accommodation, we welcome guests to stay with us during any season. Your RV and camping experience will be the best one yet at our resort, so book online for reservations! Whether your RV is a small or large, our partial or full service sites are spacious and private to suit any size RV. We have sites closer to amenities or more secluded, providing different options for every need. Don’t have an RV? We offer an exclusive tenting area with secluded or open sites available. Our resort has easy access to four golf courses, hiking and biking trails, fishing, swimming and other attractions and activities. The kids will love our on-site playground, perfect to meet new friends! For your convenience, we have clean washrooms and showers, a heated pool, year round hot tub, nine hole golf course, and trout pond available for use.
amenities: Facilities iconFacilities icon for website, application, printing, document, poster design, etc. Meeting Facilities

campgrounds.name: Willingdon Beach Municipal Campsite
campgrounds.address: 4845 Marine Ave Powell River, BC V8A 5T3
campgrounds.description: We are an 83 site (RV and tenting), municipal campground on the ocean, in the heart of Powell River, on the Sunshine Coast of BC. We are located next to a park, playground and the beach. Surrounded by beautiful hiking and walking trails, there is lots to see and do!
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesServiced $38-$41.40 Partial Service $30-$41.50 Unserviced $27.50-$36 Tenting $25.75-$36. Rates subject to change.

campgrounds.name: 'Ksan Campground
campgrounds.address: 1450 River Road Hazelton, BC V0J 1Y0
campgrounds.description: We here at the ‘Ksan Campground welcome guests with open arms. Come here for tenting and full-service sites. We are located near the Historical Pioneer Village of Hazelton and directly beside the Ksan Historic Museum and Village. Our small little town has various places for tourists to wander to and explore. Right down the street from us is the Tri-Town Theatre showing modern movies at competitive prices. Come stay with us! If you have questions, feel free to call or email us and we will help you.
campgrounds.rates: Serviced sites starting at $37.50 per 5 persons Unserviced sites starting at $20 per 2 personsTenting sites starting at $20 per 4 persons

campgrounds.name: 4 All Seasons Resort
campgrounds.address: 3464 Yellow Point Rd RR3 Ladysmith, BC V9G 1E6
campgrounds.description: A family owned camping facility, situated on inside coast of Vancouver Island on the Cedar peninsula, covered by mature trees and bounded by beautiful rock beaches over 100 sites in a treed setting. 3 night minimum stay for long weekends.
campgrounds.rates:

campgrounds.name: Acacia Grove RV Park & Cabins
campgrounds.address: 3814 Riverview Ave E Spences Bridge, BC V0K 2L0
campgrounds.description: Located in the historic community of Spences Bridge, Acacia Grove RV Park & Cabins is situated on a lush setting overlooking the famous Thompson River. Our well-appointed duplex and triplex cabins are self-contained with air conditioning, fully-equipped kitchens, two or three beds, and picnic tables. All the cabins have fantastic views of the roaring river. The RV Park is situated on a landscaped setting surrounded by beautiful trees to provide shade. We offer full hookup, pull thru and tenting sites, accommodating to everyone’s needs. For your convenience, free hot showers, flush toilets, and a laundromat is available for use. Also, a small convenience store, pay phones, game room, horseshoes, lawn bowling, volleyball and more are on-site. Our excellent location is ideal for sportsmen, families and nature lovers! Enjoy the Thompson River, famous for steelhead fishing, whitewater rafting and mountain sheep. Endless amount of outdoor activities to keep the family busy and fantastic weather to enjoy the outdoors.

campgrounds.name: Alamo Motel & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 4898 Edwards Road Quesnel, BC V2J 6L1
campgrounds.description: 21 sites with electrical hook-ups, pull thru sites. Flush toilets, showers, sewer and restaurant onsite. RV Park open seasonally. Water shut-off in October, weather dependent.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesServiced $20-29/electricity

campgrounds.name: Alder Bay RV Park & Marina
campgrounds.address: 1 Alder Bay Rd. Port McNeill, BC V0N 2R0
campgrounds.description: With a relaxed and family friendly atmosphere, we are a great location to get away from the hustle bustle and stress of daily life. At Alder Bay you're just as likely to meet up with a local island family from the nearby community of Port McNeill as you are to find yourself in a friendly conversation with RVers from Germany or Switzerland! Alder Bay Resort is ideally suited to be the focal point of your Northern Vancouver Island adventure. With 30 acres of private land including abundant walk-on waterfront Alder Bay RV Park and Marina welcomes you and your family! Our park includes over 100 fully-serviced and non-serviced RV and tent sites. We can accommodate everything from small pop-ups to the big rigs. On site are public washrooms, shower rooms, and laundry facilities. Our camp store is stocked with essentials, there is WiFi available for purchase plus firewood and propane is also available. We also have a sani-dump, potable water stations, boat wash station and picnic shelter all at your disposal. Alder Bay is your access to the Broughtons so take advantage of our protected marina with over 40 slips, fish cleaning station, boat launch facilities and ample parking and get out on the water and explore! We also have long term storage so come on up and leave your boat or RV here for safekeeping until your next visit. Don’t feel like cooking? Then come and enjoy our funky soul food at Roxy’s Diner! https://www.roxysdiner.ca. In addition to classic fare - burgers and fish & chips - you'll also find some tasty Mexican specialties - tacos, chilaquiles and more. Enjoy the sunset on our beautiful fully licensed patio on the seashore or take advantage of our take out service by ordering online at https://www.roxysdiner.ca/s/order. Call our office ( 250-956-4117) for all the details or check out our web page and book online at [https://www.alderbay.com/book-now.html](). Looking to add a little adventure to your stay with us? Check out some of our Alder Bay Adventures under our activities page on our website. Whale Watching, Fishing , Grizzly Bear Tours is just a few of the available options right from our bay! We welcome Canadian Winter Snowbirds with open arms.
campgrounds.rates: Serviced $38-$46 Unserviced $28 Tenting $28 Travel Trailers for Rent Off-season rates

campgrounds.name: Aloha Trailer Park & Campground
campgrounds.address: 29666 Fraser Hwy C-9 Abbotsford, BC V4X 1V2
campgrounds.description: Full or partial RV hookups, tenting, coin showers, laundry, store with gas/propane and bus stop nearby. No fires permitted. Minutes from attractions and shopping centre. Weekly and off-season rates. Reservations not accepted, first come, first serve basis. Cash only.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates$45 for 1 or 2 people full hook-up, subject to change

campgrounds.name: Alpine Meadows Resort
campgrounds.address: 3400 Dunn Lake Road Clearwater, BC V0E 1N0
campgrounds.description: Situated on the hilltop above Hallamore Lake, Alpine Meadows RV Park is just beyond the Resort’s entrance, surrounded by the majestic forest in BC’s beautiful Dunn Peak Provincial Park. Our RV sites provide guests with spacious asphalt pads and grass area to create a comfortable stay. Each of our 17 sites offer full hookup and a modern washroom and shower facility. All of our resort amenities are offered and a close walking distance from your site. Visit our Boathouse Restaurant during breakfast and dinner, and indulge in fresh cuisine made from local ingredients. During the evenings, relax at our Fireside Lounge and Barbecue Area. Take advantage of our boat and fishing equipment rentals for a day of fishing on Hallamore Lake. The kids will enjoy our outdoor Activity Centre that offers games, a ping pong table, playground, mega-size chess, and generous green area.
campgrounds.rates:
Camping RatesServiced $45/night Addl $5/night

campgrounds.name: Anahim Lake Resort & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 2799 Reed Rd Anahim Lake, BC V0L 1C0
campgrounds.description: Anahim Lake Resort lies on the eastern slope of the Coastal Mountain region in BC's Chilcotin. Situated on the shore of Anahim Lake panoramic views of the mountains are a daily treat. The resort offers the vacationer Rustic Simplicity, top-notch down-home service and excellent fishing. Accommodations include cozy cabins, RV and lakeshore campsites. We also offer boat and motor rentals, trail riding, flight seeing, fly-in fishing, guided spring chinook salmon fishing, hiking and fish smoking; try wind surfing or you can just relax and watch the time go by. Casual dress is the norm not the exception.To make the most of your visit to our area, binoculars, cameras and fishing gear are essential.

campgrounds.name: Apple Beach RV Park
campgrounds.address: 915 Bulrush Road Oliver, BC V0H 1T2
campgrounds.description: Apple Beach is a small, family-run RV Park and campground. We operate a simple, pleasant RV Park on beautiful Tucelnuit Lake. Simply put, Apple Beach is a quiet, friendly park in a lovely location. One firepit on the beach. Big Rig Friendly sites shaded by mature willows. Quiet pets accepted. Rates on website. Trailer rentals available. Snowbird rates.

campgrounds.address: 1980 Union Rd. Kelowna, BC V1V 2E8
campgrounds.description: RV Park in and around existing orchard groves of apples, peaches and cherries. Great valley view and close to all amenities. Very private and quiet. Nestled in the beauty of the Glenmore Valley, in the heart of the Okanagan Wine Country. 15 minutes to two lakes and a dozen golf courses. Weekly and monthly rates available.

campgrounds.name: Armstrong Kin RV Park
campgrounds.address: 3311 Park Drive Armstrong, BC V0E 1B0
campgrounds.description: Situated in the heart of Armstrong, Armstrong Kin RV Park offers landscaped sites with full hookups of 30 amp electricity, water and sewer. We offer some shaded and pull through sites for larger RVs. Stay connected during your trip with our WiFi. For your convenience and comfort we have clean, full washrooms which include free showers. We are conveniently located behind the fairgrounds and across the street from Memorial Park and Pool. Bring the whole family as they will be entertained throughout the day! Discover the beauty of this small farming town and its outdoor activities. Many farms and orchards decorate the landscape of Armstrong. Visit Wild Mountain Honey Farm and purchase tasty sweet honey, or pick delicious apples at Maw’s Orchard. The kids will love Chickadee Ridge, Canada’s largest miniature horse farm! Pet and meet the tiny horses and other farm animals.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates$25-$50 per 2 persons

campgrounds.name: Arosa Ranch
campgrounds.address: 1 Arosa Ranch Road Bridesville, BC V0H 1Y0
campgrounds.description: Just twenty kilometres from Osoyoos, BC, nestled in the rolling Okanagan hills and surrounded by wildlife, Arosa Ranch is a peaceful and picturesque getaway.  Our Bed & Breakfast Rooms, Cabins, and Campground/RV Park, are the perfect place for a quiet retreat to nature, a vacation with friends and family, or your next celebration, event or retreat.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates RV Sites $45; Tenting $35 Room Rates $120/night

campgrounds.name: Arrowvale Riverside Campground and Cottages
campgrounds.address: 5955 Hector Rd. Port Alberni, BC V9Y 9E8
campgrounds.description: Nestled on lush riverside grounds in beautiful Port Alberni, Arrowvale Riverside Campground & Cottages offers a traditional camping experience. With picturesque vistas surrounding our property, you’ll find it easy to sit back and relax. Choose from one of our 40 campsites with many situated near the Somass River. We offer open and wooded sites with some being serviced and others unserviced. Our grounds have fantastic walking trails, swimming and fishing along the Somass River, a great way to spend the day with the whole family. Guests wanting to sleep indoors are treated to our charming cedar cottages with luxurious features. Relax under the vaulted wooden ceilings while sitting by the see-through gas fireplace. The cottage features one queen and a futon bed, sleeping up to four guests. Other amenities that guests are treated to include free showers, WiFi and restrooms. Seasonal services that are featured at our resort are a café, serving delicious baked goods, and free farm tours, where the kids will enjoy petting the farm animals.

campgrounds.address: 102 Railway Ave, Ashcroft, BC V0K 1A0
campgrounds.description: Camp in desert country on the shores of the Thompson River, next to downtown historic Ashcroft. Legacy Park provides a shady, relaxing oasis. Easy walking distance to downtown Ashcroft for shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions. The 15 site park offers washrooms, showers, laundry facilities and sani dump station. Sites have power, water and free WiFi.

campgrounds.name: Bailey Bridge Campsite & Cabins
campgrounds.address: Salloompt Rd Hagensborg, BC V0T 1H0
campgrounds.description: Your hosts, Keith and Val, invite you to enjoy your stay with us on the banks of the Bella Coola River. Whether it be secluded, wilderness or spacious campsites or cabins, all are available while you enjoy world class river fishing for salmon and trout or as a base for your hiking or touring adventures. Take advantage of the many hiking areas or utilize other services in the Valley such as ocean excursions, river drifting, nature tours or heli-hiking.

campgrounds.name: Banbury Green RV & Camping Resort
campgrounds.address: 930 Pineview Drive Kaleden, BC V0H 1K0
campgrounds.description: Nestled away from the city noise, Banbury Green RV & Camping Resort is a peaceful destination for families wanting a fun and relaxing vacation. Our resort is a family-oriented campground with attractively kept lawns and flowerbeds. We have an abundance of shaded areas to stay cool during the warmer days. We accommodate for most RVs and tents, and all sites have electricity and water. Most of our sites are lakefront to maximize the breathtaking views. Picnic tables are at each site for families to eat their meals or play board games. We have plenty of open space for the kids to run around and ride their bikes. Enjoy the serene lake on our pedal boat and canoe rentals. We have a generous size grass area with a net for volleyball or badminton, a fun way for families to spend quality time. After a fun filled day visit our store and indulge the whole family to ice cream and other frozen treats!

campgrounds.name: Barney's Lakeside Resort & Bistro
campgrounds.address: 3556 Puntzi Lake Road Chilanko Forks, BC V0L 1H0
campgrounds.description: Relax in the peace and quiet of the Chilcotin. Wildlife abounds with deer, moose, bear, wild horses, fox and numerous species of birds. A 12-acre lakeside resort, located on beautiful Puntzi Lake. The lake (approximately 11km long and 5km. Fishing for wild rainbow trout and kokanee salmon. Hunting, wildlife viewing, hiking, mountain biking, ATVing, water and jet ski, swimming ice fishing and snowmobiling. We are halfway from Williams Lake to Bella Coola, make Barneys your Home Base and experience the Chilcotin.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Serviced $40; Partial $35; Lakeside/Power $35; Unserviced $30 Tenting $25 per 2 persons Add'l Adult $5 Child Under 10 Free Room Rates 1 - 6 bedroom for large groups; 1 - 2 bedroom; 3- 1 bedroom. Call for rates

campgrounds.name: Bates Beach Oceanfront Resort
campgrounds.address: 5726 Coral Road Courtenay, BC V9J 1W9
campgrounds.description: Enjoy the spectacular view of the Inside Passage to Alaska at Bate Beach Oceanfront Resort. Located just north of Courtenay, adjacent to Seal Bay Nature Park on Georgia Strait, there are excellent hiking and cycling trails, canoeing, beach-combing and more. We offer different styles of accommodation, including unit rentals and oceanfront camping. We have an oceanview suite that has amazing views of the Strait of Georgia, Coastal Mountain Range and the Inside Passage to Alaska. The suite features a full kitchen, living room, full bathroom and a bedroom. Our oceanfront campground sites are full hookup with power, water, sewer, cable TV and wireless internet. For your convenience, we have a washroom facility with coin operated showers and laundry available. The resort offers salmon fishing with boat and kayak rentals to explore sand bars, tidal pools and rock reefs. Enjoy marine mammal viewing with seals, sea lions, river otters and the occasional Killer and Humpback whales are also observed. For the children, we have a sheltered playground and other fun activities.

campgrounds.name: Bayside Campground & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 6040 Sechelt Inlet Road Sechelt, BC V0N 3A3
campgrounds.description: This campground offers full and partial service RV sites and private tent sites. Satellite TV, hot showers, playground, volleyball, horseshoes. Convenient to Sechelt Inlet, Porpoise Bay Provincial Park, beaches, hiking, biking trails, golf, galleries, villages and services.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesServiced $30-35; Unserviced $30=-$25

campgrounds.name: Beattie's RV Park
campgrounds.address: 9814 Fredette Ave Hudson's Hope, BC V0C 1V0
campgrounds.description: Located in the centre of Hudson’s Hope, Beattie’s RV Park is a great destination for travellers to spend the night or guests planning to stay a week long. We are conveniently near Beattie’s Park, swimming pool, grocery stores and restaurants, to suit all the needs. We offer 20 RV sites will full service hookups, including sewer, water and cable. Our grassed sites offer enough space for your RV to comfortably park. For your convenience, a shower room and laundry facilities are available for use. Situated in a prime location, guests can enjoy the local attractions of Hudson’s Hope. Learn more about the town’s history at the Hudson’s Hope Museum or tour the WAC Bennett Dam and Peace Canyon Dam. Surrounded by glorious parks and trails, Hudson’s Hope provides scenic leisure walks or challenging hikes.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesDaily, weekly and monthly rates available.Room RatesWeekly and monthly rates availableElectricYes

campgrounds.name: Beaver Lake Mountain Resort
campgrounds.address: 6350 Beaver Lake Road Lake Country, BC V4V 1T5
campgrounds.description: Nestled on the shore of Beaver Lake, escape the hustle and bustle of city life to our tranquil mountain resort in Lake Country. Beaver Lake Mountain Resort is the ideal accommodation for families to enjoy quality time and create fun memories. We offer a variety of accommodation, including cabins, camping cabins, a suite, and a campground. With 22 cabins of different sizes, guests can choose a new or historic log cabin. Our cabins have breathtaking views of Beaver Lake, and are located near or on the shore of the beautiful lake. The new cabins have cold and hot running water, and full bathrooms; the heritage cabins have only cold running water and out-house facilities. All cabins have wood burning stoves and propane stoves for cooking. Our campground offers spacious camp and RV sites in a forested landscape. Every site has a fire pit and picnic table for families to enjoy cozy camp fires and delicious meals. Showers and washroom facilities are available and located near the log camping cabins. The camping cabins accommodate up to five people and features beds and tables. There are a variety of activities families can enjoy at our resort. Fishing is our popular attraction, especially our great rainbow trout fishing. Equipment is available for rent, so no need to purchase your own equipment. Situated in a lush environment, we have a variety of trails for guests to catch sight of amazing wildlife and picturesque scenery at viewpoints.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesUnserviced $37 per 4 persons Add'l Adult $4.00Rooms with Kitchens23Room Rates$125.00-175.00

campgrounds.name: Beaver Lake Resort
campgrounds.address: Box 655, 8631 South Shore Road Lake Cowichan, BC V0R 2G0
campgrounds.description: Resting between the mountains and fir trees, Beaver Lake Resort is the ideal destination for tranquility and relaxation. Featuring spacious sunny or treed RV, tent or cabin sites, you will enjoy 1500 feet beautiful lake frontage views and private access of Beaver Lake. Our family oriented, pet friendly resort offers an array of activities. Whether it’s swimming or kayaking in the large lake, building sand castles on our sandy beaches, or hiking through the scenic trails, your days will be occupied from dawn to dusk. Our resort offers endless amenities to ensure your stay is comfortable and relaxing, this includes washroom, shower and laundry facilities, watercraft rentals, playground, sandy beaches, fire pits, an array of sports and guest programs. Located an hour from Nanaimo or Victoria, Beaver Lake Resort is the perfect getaway to immerse yourself in the beauty of Lake Cowichan.

campgrounds.description: Birch Bay Resort is located on the northeast end of Francois Lake. This first class year round family resort in Central British Columbia offers great fishing, hiking and boating - with accommodations fit for all occasions. Birch Bay offers full serviced R.V. sites each having water, power, sewer, picnic table and burning ring for your enjoyment. Each of our roomy campsites have small trees and shrubs planted between them to afford a measure of privacy.

campgrounds.name: Birch Island Campground
campgrounds.address: 6316 Walker Road Clearwater, BC V0E 1N0
campgrounds.description: 10 km north of Clearwater on Hwy 5, beautiful quiet country setting with river access, mountain views, hiking, fishing, games yard and playground. Each site is a private, treed pull-thru. No "I'm camping in a field" feeling here. Firewood, showers and WiFi. Full-service country-style store and gas nearby.
campgrounds.rates:
Camping RatesServiced $35
15 amp $31
Tent $25
Addl Adult $3, Child under 6 free
Monthly rates available

campgrounds.name: Blue Cedars RV Park & Campground
campgrounds.address: 4433 Kimball Road Prince George, BC V2N 5N7
campgrounds.description: Entering into Blue Cedars Campground, guests are first welcomed to an open canopied forest of large birch trees before entering into a lush forest of Douglas-fir trees. Surrounded by the beautiful wilderness, our campground offers a tranquil setting for guests to relax and unwind. We offer 100 sites for RVs and tents that include full hookups and firepits. We have a variety of large RV sites available, including full service, partial service, pull thru and back-in. For your convenience, large restrooms, showers and laundry facilities are available for use. An onsite convenience store is available to pick up groceries and RV supplies. Lounge by the pool or take a swim during a hot sunny day or walk along the many scenic hiking trails located nearby. Nestled away from the city noise, yet conveniently near major shopping centers, restaurants and other attractions makes Blue Cedars Campground an ideal destination for guests to escape into the wilderness but with modern amenities close by.
campgrounds.rates:
Camping RatesCheck website for rates
Weekly, monthly and seasonal rates availableRoom RatesWeekly, monthly and seasonal rates available

campgrounds.name: Blue Mountain Lodge
campgrounds.address: 81 Kingsley Road Christina Lake, BC V0H 1E2
campgrounds.description: Blue Mountain Lodge Christina Lake, is set on our 1.5 acre property with a variety of beautiful trees throughout. We offer you the best in comfortable accommodations, perfect for vacations or family/group gatherings. Choose from our fully-renovated Lodge Suites, popular Cottage, cozy Rose Cabin, or full-service RV sites. Our beautiful grounds provide lots of room to play or relax. The large open grassy area is ideal for lawn games, and we have a wide variety for you to choose from. During the day, enjoy all that Christina Lake has to offer, our convenient location provides easy access for you to explore the Trans Canada and the Kettle Valleys incredible hiking/biking trails, play on the water, golf, fish, or just relax. Shops, restaurants, marina and other attractions are just minutes away. At night, settle in around the campfire while you roast your marshmallows under the stars…another wonderful day at the lake! We pride ourselves in making sure you have a comfortable, enjoyable vacation, and look forward to meeting you soon. Pre-approved dogs only.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates RV Sites $35 Tenting Sites $25 taxes extra Room Rates $95-$200

campgrounds.name: Blue River Campground & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 991 West Frontage Rd. (Hwy 5 & Murtle Lake Rd.) Blue River, BC V0E 1J0
campgrounds.description: Enjoy the space and wilderness of Blue River at our campground and RV Park. Our cabins and tipis provide a fantastic resting spot, ideal after a long day of travelling! Take a wilderness hike or bike ride; paddle a pristine mountain lake; fish a mountain stream; swim in Eleanor Lake or relax by your campfire. We offer long pull-thru full service and partial service sites, camping cabins, tent sites, cook shelter, and laundry. Bring the kids as we have an awesome children’s play area and equipment to entertain them and meet new friends. Enjoy the scenic trails with our bike rentals or catch some fish in the lake with our fish gear rentals. On a hot sunny day, drive or walk to Eleanor Lake, only a short distance from the campground. The sandy beach is perfect for kids to play and adults to unwind. The beach has a diving tower, docks, rafts and a slide that will for sure keep the whole family entertained!
campgrounds.rates:
Camping RatesServiced $38-$40 (water/electric/sewer)
Partial Service $32-$36 (electric/water)
Unserviced $30 Tenting $26

campgrounds.name: Bowron Lake Lodge & Resorts
campgrounds.address: Bowron Lake Hwy Quesnel, BC V2J 1B1
campgrounds.description: Located on the best recreational property on Bowron Lake, Bowron Lake Lodge & Resorts is the ideal vacation destination for families, retreats or groups. Situated on 254 acres on the shores of Bowron Lake, our resort is surrounded by pristine beauty. We offer a private beach that stretches over 650 meters, perfect for daily swims and relaxing on the sandy beach. We offer guests to choose among our spacious lakefront or riverside sites, whatever suits your needs. Wakeup to picturesque views of the glistening lake or to the sounds of the gentle river. The campground features hot showers and flush toilets. Covered community cooking shelters are available for guests to fix meals. All guests will be treated to panoramic views of the lake and mountain peaks. We offer beach rentals of canoes, kayaks and paddle boards for guests to enjoy. Spend a day in Bowron Lake Provincial Park to fish and catch sight of wildlife. Visit Bakerville and discover the historic gold rush site, where visitors can ride a stagecoach and pan for gold!
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesFlat Rate: $35 a site.

campgrounds.name: Bradsdadsland Campsite
campgrounds.address: 2105 Shingle Spit Road Hornby Island, BC V0R 1Z0
campgrounds.description: A family campground, a family experience. We offer spacious, unique and private campsites. Each site has it's own unique qualities and charm. Phone reservations only.

campgrounds.name: Brannen Lake RV Park & Campsite
campgrounds.address: 4220 Biggs Road Nanaimo, BC V9T 5P9
campgrounds.description: 40 acres of trees, grass & quiet. Minutes from major shopping. 110 acre lakefront farm adjoining campsite. Nightly hayrides. Swimming, hiking trails, boat-ramp, wharf, store, hot showers, flush toilets, laundry and playground. Full/partial hook-ups serving tents to R.V.'s towing a vehicle. Call us today for reservations.

campgrounds.name: Brookside Campsite
campgrounds.address: 1621 East Trans Canada Hwy Cache Creek, BC V0K 1H0
campgrounds.description: We are hidden in a lovely and unique creek side setting; and all you can see from the highway is a canopy of trees. Being BC’s hot spot on a regular basis; our trees and our heated outdoor pool are blessings which you will truly appreciate when our summer temperatures are hovering between 30-35 degrees. Nestled amongst the trees are lush lawn tenting sites, and flat fully serviced pull through RV sites. All our facilities are clean and well maintained, to provide you with a wonderfully relaxing vacation get away. Truly 'A Gem in the Desert'.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Big Rig Sites (33 – 60ft overall) $41 Full Hookups (up to 32ft overall) $36 Power/Water (up to 28ft overall) $33 Tenting $25 Add'l (18+) $3

campgrounds.name: Brookvale Holiday Resort
campgrounds.address: 1219 E Lakeshore Drive Osoyoos, BC V0H 1V6
campgrounds.description: Book your next family vacation at Brookvale Holiday Resort in sunny Osoyoos! Soak up the hot sun and bring your floaties to relax in Osoyoos Lake. Wanting to stay in a cabana or campground? We have both! Each cabana has its own cement patio and picnic table, perfect for the family to gather during meals. The interior of the cabana features a two burner hotplate, refrigerator, table with chairs, counter space, stainless steel sink and extra electrical outlet. The sleeping area is curtained off and consists of a doublewide bunk bed. We welcome tents, bumper to hitch units, tent trailers and truck campers. Our tent sites consist of water and 15 amp service. While our trailer sites have water and 15/30 amp service. Full service sites are also available. Spend your days on our beautiful sandy beach building sand castles or floating on the lake. Don’t forget to bring your water crafts as we have a boat ramp available!

campgrounds.name: Brown's Bay Resort
campgrounds.address: 15021 Brown's Bay Road Campbell River, BC V9H 1N9
campgrounds.description: Surrounded by the wonderful sights and sounds of the wilderness, Brown’s Bay Resort is the ideal getaway to relax and enjoy the beauty nature has to offer. Nestled on the shoreline, we have spectacular views of the serene oceans, majestic mountains, and lush trees. Choose from our different styles of accommodations, all with breathtaking views of the water. Enjoy the comforts of home in our luxurious cabins, each with a personalized touch to suit every need. Our campers are treated to oceanfront or oceanview RV sites from their full service concrete pads. Join us at our floating restaurant, The Narrows, for a delicious west coast meal. Visit our marina that provides you with all the amenities you need for the perfect salmon fishing trip! For your convenience, we have a variety of services available to guarantee a comfortable stay.

campgrounds.name: Burnaby Cariboo RV Park
campgrounds.address: 8765 Cariboo Pl. Burnaby, BC V3N 4T2
campgrounds.description: Deluxe RV Park for sightseeing the Vancouver, Canada area. This campground has full hook-ups for any size motorhome, trailer or 5th wheel. Separate tent camping area, indoor pool, jacuzzi (hot tub), fitness room, store. On transit route (bus, skytrain, sea bus). Guided tours of Vancouver & Victoria. CP 1 day.

campgrounds.name: Burton Historical Park Campground
campgrounds.address: 145 Lakeview Park Road Burton, BC V0G 1E0
campgrounds.description: Burton Historical Park Campground is one of the best kept secrets of the Kootenays. This lakeside campground offers a peaceful, relaxing and family-oriented atmosphere. The sites are spacious with views of Arrow Lake and surrounding mountains. Campers have access to beach and boat launch. Centrally located to nearby attractions.
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Partial Service $33.33-$35.24 Unserviced $26.67-$28.57

campgrounds.name: Cabana Beach Campground & RV Park
campgrounds.address: 2231 Lakeshore Drive Osoyoos, BC V0H 1V6
campgrounds.description: Enjoy the hot sun and sandy beach on the shore of Lake Osoyoos at Cabana Beach Campground & RV Park. Bring the family along to create unforgettable memories and spend the days filled with adventure. Choose to stay in one of our many accommodations, including camp and RV sites, cabins and cabanas. We offer grass, beachfront and full hookup sites. Most of our RV sites have 15/30 amp and sewer outlet. For your convenience we have a kitchen cabana shelter, coin-operated showers, laundry and washrooms. Our sleeping units have one bedroom with a double bed and bunk beds. The cabins and cabanas feature a cold water tap, apartment sized fridge, outdoor patio or porch and a picnic table. Soak in the hot sun on our private beach. Stretching 500 feet, our sandy beach allows guests to unwind and swim in our roped-off swimming area. Grab your bike or walking shoes and hit the paved path on Lakeshore Drive to catch sight of the panoramic lake and orchard views.
campgrounds.rates: Camping RatesCheck website for ratesRooms with Kitchens6

campgrounds.name: Camp-Along Tent & Trailer Resort
campgrounds.address: 100 Ash Avenue Kaleden Penticton, BC V0H 1K0
campgrounds.description: Quiet, clean family oriented campground in apricot & pear orchard, high above Skaha Lake. Pool, store, modern washrooms/showers, laundromat facility. Speak Deutsch/Francais
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates $24.00-$45.00 per 2 persons Add'l extra over age of 15 pays $5.00/day

campgrounds.name: Camperland RV Resort & Cabins
campgrounds.address: 53730 Bridal Falls Rd Rosedale, BC V0X 1X1
campgrounds.description: Nestled at the base of Mt. Cheam and situated off the Trans Canada Highway, Camperland RV Resort is the perfect base for travellers or families wanting to escape their busy lives for a relaxing and fun vacation. Adjacent to Bridal Veil Provincial Park and Bridal Falls Waterpark, the whole family will enjoy exploring nature or splashing in the water. With over 200 full and partial RV sites as well as tenting sites, guests have plenty of choices to find their perfect lot. We offer manicured, shady sites with 30 and 50 amp electrical hookup. Don’t have an RV? Stay in our deluxe two bedroom camping cabins that feature luxurious amenities such as a fully-equipped kitchen, cable TV, free WiFi, loft area and a private firepit! It will feel as if you’re back at home but situated in the great outdoors. We have two heated pools and two hot tubs as well as a barbecue area, general store, restaurant, liquor store, recreational hall and clubhouse to entertain the whole family. With the recent expansion, our resort now offers an open area with a vista view and a new playground, one of two on the grounds. Activities available include bingo, horseshoes, movie nights and theme weekends!
campgrounds.rates: Camping Rates Serviced from $49 Tenting from $39 Rooms with Kitchens 2 Room Rates Check website

campgrounds.name: Campers Haven RV & Tent Park
campgrounds.address: 2779 DeJordie Road Donald, BC V0A 1H1
campgrounds.description: Welcome to Campers Haven RV & Tent Park, the ideal destination for RVers and campers seeking the rest and relaxation atmosphere! Located off Highway 1 in Donald, BC, our campground offers peaceful and scenic sites for guests to enjoy a good night’s sleep. Our sites are big rig friendly as we offer pull-through sites and power, water and sewer hookups. Tent camping is also available for guests wanting to set up tents. Restroom, shower and laundry facilities are available, as well as a dump station. We also have a non-smoking motel and chalets on site. For recreation we have a horseshoe pit and volleyball for families to play. Located only a six minute drive away from Marl Creek Provincial Park, families can spend their days hiking, cycling and wildlife viewing along the scenic trails. Also, enjoy swimming, canoeing or fishing in Waitabit Creek and Columbia River.
